data.title: Understaffed service and only OK food made for a disappointing trip.
data.text:
We went for breakfast on a Saturday morning at 845 am.  At that point they had one waitress and three people in the kitchen.  The waitress kept apologizing and finally after 15 minutes someone else got there to help.  Even after that it took them what seemed like a long time to unwind the orders.  We had to ask the waitress to move our order up so we wouldn't be late.  Unfortunately when we got the food it was only OK.  My wife had Sausage Gravy and Biscuits.  The gravy was good but the biscuits were actually burnt.  I had scrambled eggs, hash browns and bacon.  The hash browns were a little underdone.

I realize the atmosphere is part of the draw here and clearly the staff knows a lot of the people there.  We may try again to see if it's better, but we may not.  If the food had been better it might have been worth the wait, but it really wasn't.

data.title: High Expectations Exceeded
data.text: My wife and her sister have enjoyed lunch here multiple times, and I could hardly wait to try it. Had the opportunity to experience breakfast this morning. The group of nine received great service and delicious food, in the classic diner atmosphere, highlighted by vintage signs, historic photographs, and furnishings reminiscent of the fifties and sixties. Elvis music complemented the entire experience. The low prices were a refreshing surprise. As author of Eternal Route 66, I get to enjoy some great vintage cafés. This one is on my favorites list.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: We were in town for a football game in Arlington. This was a fun place to take the kids. Burgers and ice cream. Food was quick even though there were a lot of people there. We enjoyed it! I got the Blues Brother Burger with fries.

data.title: Lunch vidit
data.text: Loved the food and shakes. Not fast food so don't expect to get in and out like a fast food restaurant. It is worth the wait though.

data.title: Cool place
data.text: Cool place but a bit of a run down area getting to it. We seemed to have a newer waitress who had a lot of tables. She was bogged down but tried hard. My food was just okay but presentation was good. Burger didn't have much taste an tater tots were cold. My wife and kids really liked their fries.

data.title: Great diner
data.text: First time here. The wife has been here many times for lunch. Thought we would try it for dinner. Wasn't crowed and the wait staff was extra friendly. Chelsea was at the register (Fairless) and I haven't seen her since she was very young at Strokers. The food was as good as everyone says it is. Good ole diner burgers. Lots of memorabilia around the room and trinkets to buy. Betty Boop greets you outside with Rick Fairless flair to her shoes and hat. Definitely go again!

data.title: "Just Right For A Date"
data.text: This is the perfect place to relax & enjoy an old fashion meal! Bring your "Honey Bun", and  pick a few different items & share. Finish off your meal with a Shake or Cake. You won't want to miss a visit to "Big State Fountain Grill". Full of memories from the past, you may have just forgotten about, but you will  remember for ever & ever, once you experience it with a date. Amen!!

data.title: Wish I would have tried it sooner!
data.text: I have lived in Irving for 3 years now and I can truly say that I've wasted those three years by not coming to eat at Big State Fountain Grill sooner! The food was amazing and the prices are even better. My family got a variety of dishes... the salad was huge, the chicken salad sandwich was a unique recipe (I think they used some pineapple), and the grilled bologna was amazing. The food was so good that we decided to come back again tomorrow for breakfast (only served till 10:30 FYI).

data.title: just fun
data.text: I ate light as I was having a big dinner that night.  The shakes and burgers looked great but I had to pass.  Old school diner from years gone by, friendly people.  A welcome respite from a day on the road. Thank You.

data.title: Most fun!
data.text: This place is so much fun to visit, see the sights, shop, and have good food!  Great burgers, breakfast burritos and onion rings. Oh the Blue Bell shakes are delicious and beautiful cakes, too!  Go for the fun and enjoy the food, too!

data.title: Worth a Visit.....or Two
data.text: Dropped in for just a quick bite based on the reviews on line. Wife and shared cheese fries and a beer. They were excellent! Rivals Snuffers in Dallas. But, forget the food. Go there for the experience of a 50's soda fountain with friendly and efficient servers. Nice menu with a good variety and we would have loved t try the pies. Absolutely worth the time and effort

data.title: The Bomb
data.text: Take a trip back and come on down....this place rocks.   The burgers are off the chain.  The onion rings are incredible, and the deserts...wow. Best burger is the Strokers Burger with special sauce.  I get tots, and a side of onion rings to share with my wife. All the deserts are legit...but the bars are off the chain.  Especially the Neiman Marcus bar.  Breakfast is no slouch either.  Pancakes are super big, and made perfect.  Great coffee, great eggs....and, it's an Irving institution since the 40s!

data.title: Do Not Miss!
data.text: This is a little slice of local heaven. Stopped in for lunch and had a very good burger. Burger was hot and juicy and the onion rings were excellent. Chelsey is such a nice person and really cares about this place. If your in the area stop I'm.

data.title: A great spot!
data.text:
This is a wonderful throw back to the era of the drug store & soda fountain counter.

Delicious burgers.  The menu has all sorts of goodies.  I ordered the home made chips with my meal but will try the onion rings next time.

Hand made milkshakes, lots of different dessert options.  If you're looking to get off your diet & spluge, this is the place.

Terrific service and reasonable prices.

data.title: Enjoy a Slice of er
data.text: Best burger and fries with a Blue Bell milkshake in town. Thoroughly enjoy the jukebox, the rainbow tile floor and the super cool gift shop. Great food and good fun!!!

data.title: Fairless Restaurant
data.text: Cheerful and friendly atmosphere! Great food selection and amazing Ice cream shakes.  Daily Breakfast and Lunch Specials .

data.title: What a fun place with really good food!
data.text: A group of 12 from our motorcycle group stopped here for dinner and we really enjoyed the atmosphere, food, and service.  Everyone's order was fast, correct, and good.  The place is set up like a 50's diner and many of the items on the menu are named after celebrities from the past and around the DFW area.  There are a number of interesting items on the menu, so be sure and look it over before deciding, you'll be glad you took the time because there are a number of items that you wouldn't think of unless you been there before.  We'll definitely be going back for more visits to this great little restaurant.

data.title: Good
data.text: Big state is a landmark in downtown Irving and my father in the sixties was a manager there for many yrs,the food and fountain are a step back in time of yrs gone by and worth a visit for young and old I give it a thumbs up!!

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: What a great addition to the historic district of Irving! Great atmosphere, good food, fun, quality stuff for sale. The quintessential retro experience!

data.title: Tons of old school charm!
data.text: This spot is so much fun with the retro checkered floor, the old fashioned soda fountain, and all the memorabilia of Irving in its' early days. The staff is all very friendly and it really does feel like you're stepping back in time. The menu is classic diner food and very reasonably priced. I had the patty melt with their house made kettle chips and it was stellar, perfectly gooey, with perfectly grilled patties with just the right amount of crispy char, and perfectly caremelized onions. Exactly what one wants from a patty melt! Definitely give this spot a try!
